name: io.github.SimonB97/win-cli-mcp-server
description: MCP server for secure command-line interactions on Windows systems, enabling controlled access to PowerShell, CMD, Git Bash shells, and remote systems via SSH. It allows MCP clients to perform operations on your system, similar to Open Interpreter.

tools.name: execute_command
tools.description:
Execute a command in the specified shell (powershell, cmd, or gitbash)

Example usage (PowerShell):
```json
{
  "shell": "powershell",
  "command": "Get-Process | Select-Object -First 5",
  "workingDir": "C:\\Users\\username"
}
```

Example usage (CMD):
```json
{
  "shell": "cmd",
  "command": "dir /b",
  "workingDir": "C:\\Projects"
}
```

Example usage (Git Bash):
```json
{
  "shell": "gitbash",
  "command": "ls -la",
  "workingDir": "/c/Users/username"
}
```

shell.description: Shell to use for command execution

tools.name: get_command_history
tools.description:
Get the history of executed commands

Example usage:
```json
{
  "limit": 5
}
```

Example response:
```json
[
  {
    "command": "Get-Process",
    "output": "...",
    "timestamp": "2024-03-20T10:30:00Z",
    "exitCode": 0
  }
]
```

limit.description: Maximum number of history entries to return (default: 10, max: 100)

tools.name: ssh_execute

connectionId.description: ID of the SSH connection to use

tools.name: ssh_disconnect
tools.description:
Disconnect from an SSH server

Example usage:
```json
{
  "connectionId": "raspberry-pi"
}
```

Use this to cleanly close SSH connections when they're no longer needed.

connectionId.description: ID of the SSH connection to disconnect

privateKeyPath.description: Path to the private key for the SSH connection

connectionId.description: ID of the SSH connection to update

privateKeyPath.description: Path to the private key for the SSH connection

connectionId.description: ID of the SSH connection to delete

resources.name: SSH Connection
resources.description: SSH connection to {id} with host, port, and username

resources.name: Current Working Directory
resources.description: The current working directory of the CLI server

resources.name: CLI Server Configuration
resources.description: Main CLI server configuration (excluding sensitive data)
